pr_title: CB-7040 Upgrade salt states during Datalake upgrade

replies.bodyText: it's not commented. the commented code is deleted
replies.author: lacikaaa

timeline.message:
CB-7040 Upgrade salt states during Datalake upgrade

Salt upgrade has been added in 2 places:
- before starting the runtime upgrade the states pushed down to the GW
nodes and a highstate is called. This is a separate flow which is
added to the upgrade flowchain as first step. Also the component table
is updated with the new states
- as replacing the instances is implemented using full repair, this
commit adds a step to `upgradeOs` calls where it replaces the salt
states stored in `ClusterComponent` table. In this case we don't
initiate a highstate as the new GW node will come up with the new
states during the upgrade/repair. If the upgrade/repair flow cannot be
initiated the `ClusterComponent` is rolled back to previous version as
it is a versioned entity

As a result we don't check if salt version is matching in the future.

Notable refactors:
- `ClusterRepairService#validateRepair` had a big, ugly transaction.
This has been removed and where it was necessary separate repository
calls have been introduced
- there were some hand written checks for running flows which has been
eliminated as flow engine won't accept new flows if there is one
already running
